cosmology¶

This module contains functions for calculating cosmological distances and other relevant values for the cosmhalo module.

Classes¶

class astrodust.halos.cosmology.Cosmology(h0=75.0, m=0.3, l=0.7, d=1e-05)¶
Cosmology object stores relevant cosmological parameters

ATTRIBUTES
h0 : [km/s/Mpc] : Hubble’s constant
m : cosmic mass density in units of the critical density
l : lambda mass density in units of the critical density
d : cosmic dust density in units of the critical density

Functions¶

astrodust.halos.cosmology.cosmdens(cosm)¶

Returns the co-moving number density of dust grains for a given Cosmology object

astrodust.halos.cosmology.cosmdustspectrum(amin=0.1, amax=1.0, na=100.0, p=4.0, rho=3.0, cosm=<astrodust.halos.cosmology.Cosmology object>)¶
INPUTS
amin, amax : [microns]
na : int (# of dust grain sizes to use)
p : scalar for dust power law dn/da propto a^-p
rho : grain density [g cm^-3]
cosm : Cosmology object

RETURNS : distlib.DustSpectrum
astrodust.halos.cosmology.dchi_fun(z, zp=0.0, cosm=<astrodust.halos.cosmology.Cosmology object>, nz=100)¶
Calculates co-moving radial distance [Gpc] from zp to z using dx = cdt/a

INPUTS
z : float : redshift
zp ; float (0) : starting redshift
cosm : Cosmology
nz : int (100) : number of z-values to use in calculation
astrodust.halos.cosmology.da_fun(theta, z, cosm=<astrodust.halos.cosmology.Cosmology object>, nz=100)¶
Calculates the diameter distance [Gpc] for an object of angular size
theta and redshift z using DA = theta(radians) * dchi / (1+z)

INPUTS
theta : float : angular size [arcsec]
z : float : redshift of object
cosm : Cosmology
nz : int (100) : number of z-values to use in dchi calculation
astrodust.halos.cosmology.cosm_taux(z, E=1.0, dist=<astrodust.distlib.sizedist.DustSpectrum object>, scatm=<astrodust.extinction.sigma_scat.ScatModel object>, cosm=<astrodust.halos.cosmology.Cosmology object>, nz=100)¶
Calculates the optical depth from dust distributed uniformly in the IGM

INPUTS
z : redshift of source
E : scalar or np.array [keV]
dist : distlib.DustSpectrum
scatm : ss.ScatModel
cosm : cosm.Cosmology

RETURNS
tauX : scalar or np.array [optical depth to X-ray scattering]
= kappa( dn/da da ) cosmdens (1+z)^2 cdz/hfac
astrodust.halos.cosmology.cosm_taux_screen(zg, E=1.0, dist=<astrodust.distlib.sizedist.DustSpectrum object>, scatm=<astrodust.extinction.sigma_scat.ScatModel object>)¶
Calculates the optical depth from a screen of dust in the IGM

INPUTS
zg : redshift of screen
E : scalar or np.array [keV]
dist : distlib.Powerlaw or distlib.Grain
scatm : ss.ScatModel

RETURNS
tauX : np.array [optical depth to X-ray scattering] for the screen
: = kappa(Eg) * M_d
